Description: Stamp (vessel): mikyala. Measure of indigo. Eight lines of a nine Kufic inscription visible. Fragment of rim attached. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Dudzus, Wolfgang. 1961. Frühe Umayyadische Glasstempel aus Ägypten mit Beamtennamen in den Berliner Museen. ‘Staatliche Museen zu Berlin’ 3-4. Berlin, 6g; Launois, Aimée. 1969. Estampilles, poids, étalons monétaires et autres disques musulmans en verre. ‘Bulletin d'études orientales’ XXII, 9; Balog, P. 1973. Pois et estampilles en verre et poids en bronze musulman de Musée d’Art et d'Histoire de Gèneve. ‘Gènava’ XXI. Genève, 7.

'Wāw' ('and') in the third line is miswritten, without its circular head, in fact in the form of a 'rāʾ'. Stamps for woad of all four of al-Qāsim's executives are known. The type with Yazīd b. Abī Yazīd is seen on OA+ 4039 and the other two are represented in the Balog collection (Balog 1976, 193-5, 203 where further references are given). Bibliography: Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (108)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Dā’ūd b. al-Murr
